title: Product Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, the product rule of exponents states that $$a^m a^n=a \left(m+n\right)$$.

title: Product Rule of Exponents
text: Use the product rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}{j^2 k {\left(j^2 k\right)}^3}=\frac{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^1 {\left(j^2 k\right)}^3}=\frac{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^{1+3}}=\frac{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}$$

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}{{\left(j^2 k\right)}^4}={\left(j^2 k\right)}^{4-4}={\left(j^2 k\right)}^0$$

title: Zero Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that $$a^0=1$$
